snippet: A sharp rise in violence has left the city in ruins, but Secretary of State John Kerry said negotiations in Geneva were progressing.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says talks to extend Syrian cease-fire to Aleppo are progressing, despite recent increase in violence; urges Russia to increase pressure on Bashar al-Assad to suspend attacks.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and SEWELL CHAN
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Sewell Chan from London.

lead_paragraph: A sharp rise in violence has left the city in ruins, but Secretary of State John Kerry said negotiations in Geneva were progressing.

headline.main: Talks on Syria Seek to Extend Fragile Truce to Aleppo
headline.print_headline: Talks on Syria Seek to Extend Fragile Cease-Fire to Aleppo as Violence There Surges
